etymologies: late Middle English (denoting any heel-like part or object): from Old French, literally ‘heel’, from Latin talus ‘ankle bone, heel’

definitions: a claw, especially one belonging to a bird of prey

examples.text: the mouse wouldn't have stood much chance against the peregrine's talons
the black talons of mechanized war

definitions: the part of a bolt against which the key presses to slide it in a lock.
shortDefinitions: part of bolt against which key presses to slide it in lock

definitions: (in various card games) the cards that have not yet been dealt.
shortDefinitions: (in various card games) cards that have not yet been dealt
